unnormalised: ## Feeling a Little Lost? Maybe There's an App for That! (Mental Health Edition)
normalised: Feeling a Little Lost? Maybe There is an App for That! (Mental Health Edition)

unnormalised: Hey everyone! We all know life in India can be a rollercoaster, right? From navigating the Delhi metro to dealing with demanding relatives, sometimes our mental well-being takes a backseat. But what if I told you there are little helpers right there in your pocket – mental health apps!
normalised: Hey everyone! We all know life in India can be a roller coaster, right? From navigating the Delhi metro to dealing with demanding relatives, sometimes our mental well-being takes a back seat. But what if I told you there are little helpers right there in your pocket – mental health apps!

unnormalised: I know, I know, the thought of pouring your heart out to your phone might seem a little… Bollywood dramatic. But seriously, these apps can be a game-changer. Think of them as mini Dr. Mehtas, offering support and guidance whenever you need it.
normalised: I know, I know, the thought of pouring your heart out to your phone might seem a little… Bollywood dramatic. But seriously, these apps can be a game changer. Think of them as mini Doctor Mehtas, offering support and guidance whenever you need it.

unnormalised: There's Headspace, which focuses on meditation and mindfulness. Perfect for calming those pre-Durga Puja anxieties. And Calm? Well, the name says it all! They have sleep stories narrated by famous voices – imagine Amitabh Bachchan whispering you to sleep! Sounds better than chai and biscuits, right?
normalised: There is Headspace, which focuses on meditation and mindfulness. Perfect for calming those pre-Durga Puja anxieties. And Calm? Well, the name says it all! They have sleep stories narrated by famous voices – imagine Amitabh Bachchan whispering you to sleep! Sounds better than chai and biscuits, right?

unnormalised: But it's not just about relaxation. Apps like Talkspace connect you with licensed therapists online. So, if you're feeling overwhelmed or just need someone to talk to, you can access professional help from the comfort of your 500 sq ft Mumbai apartment. Plus, it’s often more affordable than traditional therapy, costing less than Rs. 2000 a month!

Plus, it is often more affordable than traditional therapy, costing less than rupee two thousand a month!

unnormalised: Remember, these apps aren't a replacement for professional help, especially if you're dealing with serious mental health issues. Always consult a qualified psychologist or psychiatrist. Think of these apps as a supplement, a little extra care for your mind, like that extra helping of gulab jamun after a long day.

unnormalised: Just like you wouldn’t run a 10 km marathon without training, you can't expect to conquer all of life's challenges without taking care of your mental health. So, download an app, explore the resources, and give your mind the TLC it deserves! What are your favorite mental wellness tips? Share them in the comments below!
